intro: Calceolaria densifolia subsp. densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved slipper orchid, is a member of the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the Andes Mountains of South America, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its dense foliage and unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that bloom in late summer. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
